abstract: Stephen Holden Critic's Notebook describes evolution of Lincoln Center's American Songbook series, which is now in its 16th season; notes that even beyond current season's wide variety of offerings, which range from Stephen Sondheim to rapper Talib Kweli, curators of series have done impressive job of finding new talent and recognizing how conception of American music is always changing.
lead_paragraph: As it begins a 16th season, Lincoln Center’s American Songbook series has its most adventurous offerings yet.
snippet: As it begins a 16th season, Lincoln Center’s American Songbook series has its most adventurous offerings yet.

keywords.value: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts
keywords.name: organizations

headline.seo: American Songbook Series Reshapes the Canon
